description: Roman riverside settlement incorporating masonry remains, including an octagonal cistern that has been interpreted as a nymphaeum.
bibliography: Barber, and Walker. “The Weir Garden, Swainshill, Hereford and Worcester,” 1995. https://doi.org/10.5284/1026996.
Martyn, Blick, Brindle, and et al. “New Weir, Swainshill (Herefordshire).” The Rural Settlement of Roman Britain: an online resource, 2015. https://doi.org/10.5284/1030449.
Shoesmith. “The Roman Buildings at New Weir, Herefordshire.” Transactions of the Woolhope Naturalists Field Club XLIII (1980).
